Reviews.Title: “Secret De Paris...Please keep it a secret!”
Reviews.Author: Amir190311
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers said, this hotel is excellent by the best standards in Paris. It has all what you look for in Paris, easy to get to, looking forward to your relaxation time after a busy day in Paris, looking forward to the breakfast the next day, free wireless to catch up and most importantly you are always greeted with a smile and a very warm welcome. The location is very convenient and within easy reach of everything, the room was very innovative and comfortable and you cannot fault the service of the staff, they will pretty much do anything you ask them to make your stay welcome, we were quite proud we managed to find this hotel as our friends were quite jealous when they saw our Eiffel tower themed room. You can't go wrong with this hotel, we are coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Chloe H
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I chose this hotel for my birthday. It was the first time I have been to Paris and this hotel certainly didn't disappoint. The staff were wonderful and the room was amzing. Cleaned everyday and looked as if no one had even stayed in it before. We were given welcome drinks and a free bottle of champagne as soon as we arrived. We stayed in the Musee D'Orsay room which was comfortable and included everything you might need. I was a little scared about the area due to reviews I had read but the main street of Place de Clichy was fine and had large rstaurants and also more intimate settings. We particularly like the set menu from Bistro Melrose which is on the main stretch on the right hand side as you come out of the Metro station. Most of the main attractions of Paris ie touristy things take about 20 mins on the Metro to get to but very easy and cheap. All in all I loved my stay in Paris and should I return I will be staying at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gregparkin
Reviews.Content: Great hoel. The staff didnt really need to do much as we were out first thing and not back till late. But when we asked for a nice typical french bistro we were booked into one just around the corner. Brilliant meal, and exactly what we would of hoped for. The rooms and bathroom are brilliant (small but typical size in Paris). The location was also good as we were near Sacre Couer and monmatre but also close to the Metro. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel with the best employees I have ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: garethandjeanette
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through BA and chose it because we liked the idea of staying in a small hotel rather than a large chain. The reviews I had read were slightly mixed so we were visiting wiyh a completely open mind. On arrival we were given a tour of the hotel while our cases were taken to our room following which we were made coffee and asked whether we needed anything to eat as we must have been travelling for a long time. The room we were given was one of the Eiffel tower rooms which was small (as you would expect in a city) but beautiful in every way. The bathroom had a whirlpool bath which was very nice to use after hours of walking around the city and the bed was very comfortable. The maid service was also of the highest possible standard, every day the room was made to feel as though you were just checking in. If before choosing a hotel you are considering staying here then you will not be let down at all if you receive the same service which we did. Do not be put off by its location you are a five minute walk from "Place De Clichy" metro which gives good access to most stations in the city and is also on the same line as Garde Nord if you are travelling from Charles de Gaulle airport. There are plenty of wonderful places to eat within a short walk and the area feels very safe even late at night. We have travelled thoughout many cities in Europe and the United States and this hotel is the friendliest we have ever experienced. I hope the owners of this establishment read the reviews on Trip advisor as the staff here deserve some recognition for the amazing customer service they give to their customers. It is also worth mentioning that as the rooms in this hotel are themed the hotel offers for you to change rooms during your stay at no extra charge your breakfast can also be served in bed for no additional charge. The breakfast is of the highest standard and again the employees here excel with their attentive service. BRILLIANT HOTEL WE WOULD NOT LOOK TO RETURN ANYWHERE ELSE IN PARIS. If you are looking to eat out in the evening we found two restaurants which were particularly good so you might like to check them out (Bistro Lorette) and (Chez Gabrielle).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: DawnB1
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We stayed a week and tried 3 of the rooms, all very clean and full of character. Having read other reviews I would agree the overall area is not brilliant but the metro is very close by - just a short walk away and we could travel to all the main attractions really easily. The staff were very helpful and nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure”
Reviews.Author: tiddlypiddly
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve been wondering how to review this hotel because Iâ€™ve never stayed in a hotel in central Paris before, and therefore donâ€™t have anything by way of comparison. Â£200 is a huge amount of money for me and Iâ€™ve never spent anything like that kind of money on a hotel room before. However, we were only staying one night, prices seemed high overall in the city and I was intrigued by the concept. In sum: Lovely staff Building work in the building next door leads to very little rest Not worth Â£200.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming, chic boutique hotel, not quite in right location”
Reviews.Author: BettyBlueCat
Reviews.Content: Nothing is too much trouble at this Paris hotel. All the staff were friendly, kind and helpful, right from before we arrived, emailing to ask if there was anything they could do to make sure our stay would be perfect. The hotel itself is in a period building and yet is extremely modern, chic and clean, so combines character with contemporary standards. The rooms are not big -- but then I imagine this is true for all hotels at this level in Paris, and it was perfectly big enough for a long weekend. The ensuite was very good, with a lovely whirlpool bath and great shower. State of the art lighting and flat screen TV were also highlights of the room. The breakfast is excellent (if pricey), with gorgeous cheeses, fruit, bread and croissants as well as cooked options; again, nothing is too much trouble. I have not given the hotel 5 stars for one reason, and that's location. It's just not quite anywhere you want to be. The nearest Metro is Place de Clichy which is a little seedy, though there are a couple of nice restaurants there (one of which the Hotel kindly booked for us for our first night). To get to anywhere interesting, you either have a lengthy and/or complicated journey on the Metro (eg. to Chatelet Les Halles for the Pompidou) or a fairly long walk (eg. Montmartre). Apart from this, I'd recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: R0bertH_48
Reviews.Content: The best hotel we have stayed in Paris. My wife selected it from the website and it more than lived up to all our expectations.The staff were excellent. We split out stay between the D' Orsay and Trocadero themed rooms and both were really good. The Hotel is well situated being in easy reach of all the city sights either via metro (Clichy) or walking.

Reviews.Title: “Decent choice!”
Reviews.Author: elena076
Reviews.Content: We used to stay in much higher class hotels in Paris (Rafael, Regina), but this time decided to try out some cheaper options and compare quality vs price ratio. The result of our test was absolutely predictable. What you pay is what you get. In general, Secret de Paris is a nice, reasonably priced hotel. It's tiny and somehow reminds a doll-house. Use the elevator only, the staircase is too steep and unsafe! We were allocated a Mouline Rouge room which was OK and clean, only the bathroom was too basic and uncomfortable (no bathtube, no separate shower cubicle). Take flip-flops with you! The breakfast was also very basic and unvarying , luckily they cook fried eggs on demand. As to the staff we couldn't complain. They were extremely friendly and helpful, although obviously not very experienced. Last of all - the location! Probably this district is considered to be in the center part of the city, however, it is far from being a tourist one. There is only one attraction in walking distance, that is the Mouline Rouge. You must be aware that you will have to use the metro most of the time. All in all Secret de Paris is a decent choice if you are on a budget and spending in Paris only a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Star service, excellent amenities, wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rob T
Reviews.Content: This is my only experience of Paris hotels, however I have stayed in plenty of other hotels across the world and I can safely say that this place is top notch! Location The hotel is at the top of the opera quarter, within 10 minutes walk to sacre coeur in Montmartre, 10 minutes walk to Magdeline square and a couple more to concorde. It is very well situated, nicely opposite a pretty brasserie and the safety of a very nicely presented police station. Basically its not super central but it is in a great place, both for grabbing metro and main train connections, and for walking to major sites around the city. Service excellent in every way, very helpful, attentive, couldn't ask for more. Really was excellent service. Amenities excellent, food and room service was great, the room itself has excellent standards for a hotel, there's just too much to list here but it really is great. The rooms and styling can all be found on their website along with what's available at the hotel, all I can say it's really great - the food at breakfast was so good. I will definitely stay here again and will recommend the hotel very highly to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: tiddles69
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has the most pleasent helpful staff that I have come across in Paris. They went out of their way to help us with all our questions and we were not even residents. It is a small little gem in the heart of Paris and I will be staying here when I return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Sally259C
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just returned from a wonderful 3 day stay at Secret de Paris hotel 5th-8th February 2012. We were made extremely welcome by all of the staff but especially Julia. Nothing was too much trouble, the service, food and room were perfect. The decor and cleanliness was also 1st class. Nicest hotel we have stayed in. We can thoroughly recommend this hotel and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: Olli0511
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 46, one of the opera rooms. We had a view out over the street from the bedroom but because we were on the 4th floor, we were not at all bothered by any street noise. The location was great, only a short walk to the nearest metro station meaning the whole of Paris was accessible! Our room was spotless, very well decorated with a unique theme, the bathroom was beautifully done and very luxurious with a spa bath big enough for two and a rain shower. One small issue was maybe that the shower screen did not protect the floor well but really only a minor point seeing as the room and bathroom was cleaned spotlessly each day! The service was first class by all staff, they spoke fluent English and easily tolerated our attempts at French! They assisted us with local enquiries and checking a restaurant booking for us. Every conversation was friendly, easy and professionally polite. We ate one breakfast in our room and although fairly pricey was well worth it due to the quantity and choice. Other reviewers have made comments about the lack of tea/coffee facilities in the room but it can be ordered and there are plenty of Starbucks round the corner! All in all a perfect hotel and perfect holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: asmith109
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Secret de Paris coincided with a period of severe weather affecting most of Europe. We needed to spend time checking which airports were operating and which flights had been cancelled and the staff were brilliant at helping us to find out what was going on with the transport situation. They were equally good at providing information about local transport, as well as warming coffees on our arrival. If you want to understand why this hotel ranks so highly with TA reviewers it is simply because of the very professional, yet friendly, way the staff carry out their duties. The location, close to several Metro stations, makes getting around the city very easy and the rooms are comfortable, though ours was a little on the small side. There was complimentary orange juice and water in the mini-bar, and they will stock it with whatever you need. We didnâ€™t really like the glass doors between bed and bathrooms, which meant that nocturnal visits became communal activities. The breakfasts were excellent with fresh orange juice, bread and croissants as well as a selection of ham, smoked salmon and cheeses. Eggs can be cooked to order in whichever style you like. Would we go back? Of course, especially as there are some great deals to be had through the booking agencies.

Reviews.Title: “museum de orsay! very good”
Reviews.Author: Bianca B
Reviews.Content: The service was great! The people here are great and they treath you very good! We loved it and we are coming back the next time !

Reviews.Title: “On the whole, Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: a1_hotel_rater
Reviews.Content: We stayed At the Secret de Paris for three nights and stayed in the Eiffel Tower room. The Hotel is a small boutique Hotel, we found the rooms to be a good size with nice touches like different settings for the lights and a jacuzzi bath. The room was comfortable, and was quiet. We had one of the attic rooms on the top floor, even though this does mean climbing to the top of the stairs (or taking the mirrored lift), they were lovely rooms that I would recommend! The staff were friendly, and sometimes they were slightly too talkative, but helpful nonetheless. Although the location of the Hotel isn't dead central it is located close to two metro stations, and it is a pleasant walk to the more central areas of Paris (for example it is a 30minute walk to the Louvre, or you can take the metro and be there much quicker). The hotel is also close to Gare St Lazaire, where you can take the train to Versailles. Overall a good Parisian Hotel, don't be put off by the distance it is from some of the main sights, it will simply mean you get to see more of Paris, and have the opportunity to experience some of the real parts of Paris!

Reviews.Title: “An experience hotel, great location to explore the city...”
Reviews.Author: fpinchon
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night while shopping in Paris. I came for the location, walking distance from the very busy Blvd Haussman (Printemps, Galeries Lafayette, Uniqlo...) and la Madeleine (Fauchon, Hediard, Mariage Freres Teas and more), and will come back for the experience. This hotel doesn't look any different from other Parisian hotels of that standing (4 stars), but once you check in, you realize you are in for a treat! The charming staff diligently checks you in and takes you for a guided tour of the room, to ensure you are aware and can take advantage of the advanced technology you will be presented. Each room is fitted around a concept: a secret of Paris, and will surround you with the concept with props and adequate lighting, which also adjusts to your mood! Amazing! This is also the most silent Parisian hotel room I ever came to experience, a blessing for the light sleeper I am, make sure you get the reception to wake you up, otherwise, you will sleep in, guaranteed... Several thoughtful touches add to the experience and show the care taken to ensure a pleasant experience. I didn't get to use the spa and gym facilities, nor the nice breakfast, but they looked really engaging... This hotel proves it is possible to obtain great service in Paris, be pleasantly surprised with an innovative experience AND stretch your dollars, all at once! I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: angepange5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2011, and now I see that it is one of the top hotels in Paris! Yes, the rooms were small, but it's in a great location (near 2 metro stations) and the room itself is new, clean, and well styled. The bed was comfortable. The breakfast was included with our stay and amazing; there were amazing cheeses, smoked salmon, pain au chocolats and the crispiest croissants on the breakfast buffet table. They also made expresso and eggs to order. I had the most wonderful time in Paris last Spring, I would definitely stay again at this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Special boutique hotel, ideally placed in Paris - a top secret”
Reviews.Author: Christiane V
Reviews.Content: I have booked this hotel for a group of 7 couples (manager's group working together + spouses) and we have chosen different rooms as far as possible . One couple came from America, arrived early morning and could get the room early, which was very much appreciated. The staff is super friendly. You get a nice welcome with sangria and nibbles and you feel immediately like holiday , and get excited to visit Paris. They have good recommendations for restaurants, etc. They arrange taxis etc very efficiently. The rooms are small but very special, the jacuzzi is just great (we had the Musee d'Orsay room). We had no exterior view, but it didn't matter - the room is done in such a way that it is not a problem. One other couple had the Opera Garnier room , with outside view, very nice. Also Trocadero has outside view. The breakfast is quite ok for Paris and for the price - you get personal treatment for bacon / eggs etc. the rooms are very well insulated, you have absolutely no noise from the street - everyone was very happy about this and slept well. Everybody was very pleased with the stay in this special boutique hotel , which is a great thing in a quite big group. The sort of trip was a mix business & couples !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: adam g
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from our trip to London and Paris and miss the Secret so much. The hotel was excellent and all the positive reviews were right on. We stayed in the Musee d'orsay room for our entire stay as we didn't want to have to pack and unpack. The room was spacious and the bathroom with the jacuzzi tub was excellent. My girl took advantage of it on a nightly basis after a long day of walking and sightseeing. The staff spoke english and helped us with every question we had. We had a small issue with our lights going out occassionally but they took care of it immediately and the issue was resolved while we were out for the day. Another huge bonus is the steam room and sauna downstairs. They were amazing and well needed after days of sightseeing. Make sure you take advantage of them. Highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Silent hotel”
Reviews.Author: 875caroln
Reviews.Content: The level of service was outstanding. Design was perfect. The employee was impressed us the most were the ladies who worked in the continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “ORIGINAL !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: parisgoa
Reviews.Content: During our stay in Paris we had to reserve 3 nights at the Secret of Paris. Here is one places really original rooms has theme are very makes a success, we had the room Moulin Rouge, a charming and thoughtful reception, a little bit long breakfast but it is not a disaster the staff erases everything of a smile, has to make if you want to do a romantic stay, in more you are stands stores and theatre

Reviews.Title: “What an introduction to Paris”
Reviews.Author: PJVM
Reviews.Content: This amazing gem is tucked away in the streets of Paris & what an amazing place it is. After a long flight from Australia I arrived & my room wasn't available as yet, so the gracious Victoria offered to look after my bags while I went & freshened up down in their gym. After a day out & about exploring I looked forward to coming back to the hotel & resting up. And what a surprise I got. Kevin the most attentive front desk guy you could meet, showed me up to my room, one of the MusÃ©e dâ€™Orsay rooms. WOW. The room was amazing. Large bed, huge bathroom with Azzaro toiletry products. Sadly I only had around 6 hours to enjoy my stay as I had to be up at 4am to get a transfer back out to CDG. This hotel though is really a must if you'd like to experience true French style & class in the design hotel way. The hotel in it's self amazing but I always think it's the staff who make a stay enjoyable & the team of Kevin & Victoria do not disappoint. Cannot wait to return & spend longer at this property. 10/10+

Reviews.Title: “stay only there”
Reviews.Author: Michaela55
Reviews.Content: Fantasic location for sightseeing and shopping,top rooms some with bath and rainshowes Breakfast not to be missed Location is top Resturant typical and not exapnsive We stayed there three days for business Free Internet

Reviews.Title: “Great romantic place to stay in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: ChristineMorlet
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in Paris 75009, rue de Clichy. 29 bedrooms, very nicely decorated with great ideas "Moulin Rouge" bedroom is my favourite! Nice breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but not quite as impressive as i thought it might be...”
Reviews.Author: garethandlisa
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading reviews on here. Hotel was nice, very clean and in a good location not to far from main attractions. Just down from Moulin Rouge and just up from Opera house. The staff were fantastic and ever so helpfull. They lent me a laptop so i could book tickets online for the Eifel tower as the ques were huge !!. My only downside really was the hotel size and room size was not as grand as i`d have hoped for. But hey ho !! Not a real complaint just fact. Booked the hotel through Travel Republic ofr Â£155 pr room per night as a pose to the Â£355 that the hotels own website were offering !! Would not have been impressed at all for that price!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Position, Super Staff”
Reviews.Author: MsDizzyTuzza
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveller to Paris for business. When the working week is done, I routinely check-in to a boutique hotel for the weekend before returning home. I have tried a number of boutique hotels and this is the best. Why? Fantasic location for sightseeing and shopping, the rooms are really well appointed (and a decent size by Paris standards), great little bar come rendez-vous point available and the staff are extra attentive, friendly and speak great English. The modern/slightly funky decor creates a cosy intimate environment. It is not cheap, but I have paid the same or more at other places and this clearly represents the best value. Stay here you wont regret it. Suitable for both singles and couples.

Reviews.Title: “clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: recentguest2011
Reviews.Content: different rooms not very large but very clean helpful friendly staff good location

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: George R
Reviews.Content: What can I say. Perfect staff who were always ready and very happy to help and guide. Greeted with a glass of sangria and nibbles as we arrived. Walking distance to Pigalle and Opera. Metro access within 200m from hotel door via Place de Clichy. Nice little boulangeries and cafes/restaurants within walking distance too! All in all a great place to stay if in Paris with a twist (see themed rooms).

Reviews.Title: “Great little hideaway”
Reviews.Author: flomo123
Reviews.Content: Lovely little concept hotel. Very clean. Staff are exceptiionally helpful and smiley. The rooms are small and in ours, the bathroom was built into it with patterned glass panels, but this was not really a problem. Very well insulated sound wise and quiet heating controls. Big flat screen TV with HDMI cable, free wi-fi with good signal. Double bed is a decent size. Fitness area and sauna/steam room available but did not make use of it despite best intentions. The area is nice, quiet but not too quiet, with some good local food shops. Metro connections are not brilliant and it's a little bit away from the centre so no nipping back to the hotel during the day. And for all you Brits out there - beware, there is no kettle!

Reviews.Title: “SEcret Hotel”
Reviews.Author: willtippet
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was quite different than any we have stayed in during Europe trips. First off it is fairly new so everything is clean and brand new. The rooms are large by Euro Standards including a king size bed and a large bathroom area. Nice Features. The bathroom is not the most private and I don't think If you were traveling with a sibling or Parent it would be ideal at all. The room as wifi as well as 60 inch TV's. Late night Paris TV is not at all like the USA so if you have kids watch out! The people could not have been any nicer. Three minute walk to the Metro but if you don't want to take Metro's or Taxi's this location is not too convenient. We Metro everywhere and it is the only way to travel unless money is no object. Nice place

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: Rcallier0025
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed in the moulin rouge room great room good size for a Paris hotel. Really didn't have a problem with the bathroom as some have complain about. also the staff is very helpful and full of tips. You can walk to the opera house in 13 min, and get to pigalle area in about 5 min walk. also subway abut 4 min walk north of hotel. Over all had a wonderful stay there. i do wish i took advantage of changing to the different them rooms just to see each one, but maybe next time

Reviews.Title: “Best kept "Secret"”
Reviews.Author: Katie T
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were just so wonderful and accommodating! Always cheerful and patient with their guests! Even seeing them on the streets in Paris, they stopped to say hello and see if everything was satisfactory with our stay. It was very clean which is my number one concern when I travel. This hotel is in walking distance to many of Paris' great sights, including the Moulin Rouge, which is also one of their many themed rooms. It is so quirky and upbeat. The spiral staircase almost gives you an Alice in Wonderland type feel when looking down from the top. They also offer a workout room and the option to change rooms every night if you want so you can get a feel of all their wonderfully themed rooms. You will not be disappointed with this hotel. It is definitely one of kind and worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - great themed rooms”
Reviews.Author: laurascudders
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2 different rooms - Musee D'Orsay and Eifel Tower - and margianlly preferred the Musee one, although both were good. The rooms aren't huge, but big enough and well decorated. The bathrooms are very stylish, with good showers and/or jacuzzistyle tubs. Staff were friendly and helpful. Â£ mins work to Place de Cluny metro, 10 mins from Sacre Coeur or Moulin Rouge (try Chez toinetter or Al Caratello - see reviews - for dinner, each about 10-15 mins stroll away), or 5 mins from Gare de Lazard. We didn't have breakfast here, but grabbed something from the bakery about 2 doors away, both cheap and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Tiring days but nice hotel to rest”
Reviews.Author: rick g
Reviews.Content: The service is fantastic, the rooms are adorable and clean, the staff is wonderful, and the location is great. Each room is designed very well, from the lighting fixtures to the decor. I also loved french-door windows. We opened them every night and listened to the sounds of Paris as we fell asleep. The attention to deal was just perfect! The breakfast which was included in the deal was also lovely, and fresh. Bed was more than confortable specially after a day in this hectic but nevertheless gorgeous town

Reviews.Title: “Unique and diverse experience”
Reviews.Author: Erez_D
Reviews.Content: It's rare to find an hotel which turns out to look better in real life than in its promo pictures, and that was the case in Secret de Paris. We stayed there for 5 nights and tried 3 different rooms (Opera, Moulin Rouge and Eiffel Tour) and really enjoyed each of them! On top of the beautifully designed rooms we were welcomed with a very friendly hotel staff. The hotel breakfast is worth the 17 EUR and is highly recommended, and the coffee is the best one that we've had in France.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, ok location”
Reviews.Author: blueky333
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on the 21st and 22nd of Aug. The rooms are on a smaller side but plenty of room for 2 people. We stayed in the moulin rouge room on the 5th floor and had a street view. I liked the room design alot and the themed rooms give it character but it is still very modern. Bathroom was nice and clean. The shower head looks better than it is but is still good. Breakfast is a buffet of cold cuts and breads than you chose how you would like your eggs and they cook them to order. The eggs are abit overcooked and the bread is stale. If you go down place de clichy there is some great cafes. The location is ok, not fantastic. Its right near the moulin rouge and pigalle rd which is know for its red light district and is not safe at night. It is about a 20min walk to the champes elysees, which is the main road. Staff were helpful at times with making bookings and always being polite. We did have a issue with our laundry though, on the price list they do not mention it is a pressing service not a cleaning service. The 1st night we got there we needed our washing done so we took it downstairs expecting it to be back by the next afternoon. It was not there until 10am the morning we were checking out when we wanted to be gone by 8am. We finally got our washing and the bill was for 180 euros!!! We estimated it would cost around 50euros! There was nothing we could do about it but pay it. I would suggest to walk down the road for 1 min and go to the laundry mat yourself. We wish we saw it before we dropped our washing off and went there. We also had a issue with parking. The carpark is about 6 blocks away so best to drop your bags off than go park. It is also a very complex carpark to get in and out of. The desk where you are ment to pay is on level 3 hidden. It would of been nice if the hotel staff knew this instead of making us walk around of 30mins looking for it. Overall nice hotel nice rooms but crap location will we stay somewhere more central.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy all the best Paris has to offer”
Reviews.Author: marianarrs
Reviews.Content: As soon as you get in the hotel you feel a glamourous atmosphere where sophistication and comfort merge in a harmonizing way. The rooms are very nicely decorated and have a good size compared to what usually is found in Paris. The bathroom is a serious candidate for "the best thing in the room", especially if you pick it with a bath. The hotel breakfast is highly recommendable and has a lot of organic products. From the hotel it is possible to walk to several metro stations and even take a walk to some touristic sites. I was in Paris for several times and this hotel is definitely my top choice.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel worth avoiding the big names for”
Reviews.Author: Panda_and_Flossy
Reviews.Content: We visited Secret De Paris during July 2011 for a long weekend city break staying in a Trocadero room with breakfast included, our experiences are as follows: POSITIVES >Jacuzzi â€“ Nice to unwind after a hard days walking >Room decor â€“ Modern, well equipped and well thought out >Friendly staff â€“ Always on hand to offer advice and gave great restaurant recommendations >Well Equipped Gym â€“ We didnâ€™t use it but it was there if needed along with a Sauna >Mood Lighting â€“ Gave a nice relaxing room ambience >Complimentary drinks in room â€“ Water and Orange all complimentary >Rain Shower â€“ Above the bath >Climate controlled air con â€“ Kept the room lovely and cool >Flat screen with DVD â€“ A nice touch if you decide to stay in the hotel on an evening NEGATIVES >Location â€“ A little walk from the centre of Paris but quite close to Pigalle (but still at arms length) >Bar â€“ The bar area is lovely but can seem very quiet and lonely if you are the only ones in there >Room size â€“ Small and a little cramped but that should be expected in a city centre >Bathroom privacy â€“ Now this may affect some couples more than others and may only apply to the Trocadero room but the bathroom door & wall are made from glass which is only frosted on the bottom half. Therefore anyone showing will be completely on show from the waist up and it may seem a little strange watching someone in the shower. (The toilet is completely private however please be aware that glass is also not a great soundproofing material!) Overall a great boutique hotel for Paris with the little touches and personality often lost in larger chain hotels. Whilst the hotel was on a busy road and we were on the first floor we never heard any traffic noise. We would definitely stay at the Secret De Paris again should we ever re-visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: MandiBabii85
Reviews.Content: So many good things to say about this hotel. I'd like to start off by saying we arrived in the evening (11pm) check in was very quick, we were shown around the hotel by Marco who was very helpful. We stayed in the Moulin Rouge room, it was beautiful! I haven't got a bad thing to say about the room. Everything was very clean an pristine. The shower was amazing! Great that the water comes from both the ceiling and the wall. We were spoilt for choice. The windows were most definitely sound proof, we had a peaceful sleep all three nights that we stayed there. The location is great not too far from the Metro stations. there are plenty of restaurants near by. I have not one negative comment to say about this hotel! It was a pleasure to stay there. Hopefully we'll return next year

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. Read my review to address others' negative reviews....”
Reviews.Author: Kirsten H
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on reviews we read on Trip Advisor and Hotels.com and we couldn't be happier with our stay! Everything that every review says (the numerous positive ones) is/are true. The service is fantastic, the rooms are adorable and clean, the staff is wonderful, and the location is great. Each room is designed very well, from the lighting fixtures to the decor. I also loved loved LOVED the two (yes, two!) french-door windows. We opened them every night and listened to the sounds of Paris as we fell asleep. Instead of repeating more of the same praises found in other reviews, I would like to address some of the negatives that people discussed: Location being "far away" from everything: Yes, you're in a more residential area of Paris. EMBRACE THAT. There are fewer tourists, McDonald's, Starbucks, etc. You're not fighting with crowds every day, and you can actually experience Paris the way you should. Stop in a neighborhood cafe, practice your French at the bakery, see a movie! These are all things that can significantly add to a vacation! You are within four short blocks in either direction from a Metro. My husband and I took the Metro everywhere we went and no "tourist" destination took us over twenty minutes of travel time. We also saved a lot of money by eating breakfast and lunch at neighborhood locations. Something worth noting is that since you're in a more residential area, late July/early August will have many closed shops for vacation. The streets are a little dark at night because of these closures, but I don't expect this to be a problem other than the July 20 - August 20 time frame. The rooms are small: Umm, it's a Paris boutique hotel. This is not the United States where everything is huge. Stop expecting the Hilton with full-sized closets and dressers. The rooms are small, but ridiculously well designed and charming. There is plenty of storage space. These rooms are no different than you would see in New York City or Chicago. Space is expensive in large cities - embrace the fact that they've done such a good job with the space they provide! The bathrooms: Ok, the bathrooms are a little interesting. The shower and sink area are really cute, but the toilet is not blocked off in any way, and half of the door is clear glass. That being said, you could be doing your business and your travel partner could see everything through the glass door. This is a little awkward, and they should've put a separate door on the toilet area. You very well may be asking your travel partner to leave the room while you handle some things, and this situation is definitely worth noting. As for me, I don't spend my entire vacation in the bathroom and I would choose the other amazing qualities of this hotel over a silly design flaw. We loved loved LOVED this hotel and can't wait to go back and visit again. I imagine fall would be a glorious time to stay at this hotel because the hustle and bustle has returned to this section of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: Paulo1179
Reviews.Content: Small room, but great bathroom. Good location close to the metro stations and a short walk into central Paris. I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect..romantic..wonderful memories were made here.”
Reviews.Author: jo1006
Reviews.Content: I knew I was being taken to Paris, but was not informed where we were staying. When we arrived here, I was speechless. From entering the hotel, the reception from the staff was warm, welcoming and informative. The hotel itself was perfect. A true gem. It was so beautiful, with every feature well thought out, and wonderfully explained by the young lady showing us round. The elevator is spectacular and rather naughty...as we found out to our delight and surprise (you have to see it to believe it!) Our room was beautiful, mood lighting, complimentary soft drinks. A climate controlled haven of peace and romance. The bathroom is spectacular (there isn't a word in the English language to describe the bath) with its mood lighting, jacuzzi bath (gin guzzling, bath sharing delights in the afternoon). The bed was amazingly comfortable, and nothing at all to pick fault at. My companion has visited Paris on numerous occasions, and has now fallen in love with the place all over again. I am hooked. We will visit again, and hope our stay will be at this amazing, tres chic and very beautiful hotel. Thank you to all the wonderful friendly staff, and thanks for making my first trip to Paris so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Margaret R
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay , we found this boutique hotel to be very friendly and welcoming . The rooms are a little small but beautifully done to different themes . Breakfast was good and the service was wonderful . Well located and within walking distance to shops and metro . We would stay here again if we returned to paris . The gym facilities were small but they did have a sauna and showers , this hotel is good value for money .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Embrace01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at SDP in July and was highly impressed , the breakfast was the best iv had in all the hotels iv stayed in at France , it was almost as if the staff were trying to stuff food into you knowing the days activities (in a really good way) Paul the young waiter in training was very accommodating and polite , it made breakfast a must do ! The room was amazing (stayed in the Eiffel tower room) small which is standard for Paris but really set out different , it had a DVD player and surround sound which was awesome so you can play your own personal DVDs and music the toiletries (azzaro) were top quality , the theme for every room really makes you want to stay in rather then go out , the staff offered us to stay in other rooms on other nights so as to sample the different themes which was awesome ! the lighting set out was perfect as you can dim or highlight certain parts of the room and bathroom which made the room even more amazing . The location is in a perfect spot as your a walk away from the redlight district and the major shopping areas yet still not in the middle of everything giving way to some quiet sleep. Lastly the service was also the best i had in France - special mention goes to Adis & Veronica (reception) they absolutely went out of their way to do what ever we wanted to make us comfortable - we had checked out of the hotel only to reutrn in a weeks time to paris to catch a flight but it was in the night time as we got there in the morning , they let us keep our bags in a secure room and offered us a room to shower in and freshen up and some drinks even though we had finished our stay a week ago ! that service pretty much speaks for itself .......Remarkable !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, brill alternative to boring and pricier hotels. great service.”
Reviews.Author: richtbc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in mid-August and it was a pleasure to stay at such a great hotel. The rooms were great and its worth looking on the website to get an idea to which idea you want. We stayed in the eiffel room and the opera room and they were both great, especially the bathrooms. We had breakfast in bed both times and there were no extra charges for this which was good. The service throughout was great including all reception staff and front of house. Viorica was particularly cheery and helpful. Would go back on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “So Different”
Reviews.Author: pjm1963
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Secret de Paris which is such a different & fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Full of character!!!”
Reviews.Author: mangomonkey85
Reviews.Content: The hotel has it's own story and each room is styled on a parisean landmark. Fabulous bathrooms with jacuzzi bath and atmospheric lights under the water. Staff were cheerful and helpful. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Marshall80
Reviews.Content: The employees are very attentive to detail and very helpful. The breakfasts are fantastic and the location is very nice. Small boutique hotels like this one make a trip all the more fun.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, lovely hotel, ok location”
Reviews.Author: Princess_Di_26
Reviews.Content: I can definitely see why this hotel is rated so well on trip advisor - the service is faultless! From our first arrival to the day we left, we felt right at home in this lovely secret of a hotel, would definitely recommend to others and stay here again. Positives: - Fantastic service every time! - Excellent breakfast - well worth the 15 euro if you prebook. Fresh eggs, best coffee on our Europe trip and amazing bread - Although very small, lovely room with great lights and a fantastic bath - Close to a train station - The hotel can book transfers for you with no problem and a reasonable price - Free wifi Negatives: - The location is good, but not amazing. We could walk to some of the sights, but would have probably preferred to stay in another area. However the service and hotel itself definitely makeup for the location! - The room is small, but unless you pay a fortune, so are all of them in Paris Would recommend and return.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Northernpar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights en-route from the Cote D'Azure to catch some Paris life. Booked on basis of reviews so wasn't sure what to expect but wasn't disapointed. We love boutique hotels so this fitted the bill perfectly. Ideally located with a quirky design theme. The rooms are the size you would expect for most city centre hotels. Not huge but very well designed to utilise space. Very clean with great service from the staff. Excellent breakfast in a very relaxing setting. Rooms very quiet and beds extremely comfortable plus great bathroom facilities. Hotel has a gym and steam room but never got round to using them. Only minor improvements would be tea/coffee facilities in the rooms however room service can cover that. Only other improvement suggested (which others have noted) is extra privacy for the bathroom. Didn't bother myself or my wife but could see others feeling a little uncomfortable. Would we come back? Definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Very unusual boutique hotel... I would certainly stay there again”
Reviews.Author: AJG7
Reviews.Content: The rooms are themed and very unusual. I had the Moulin Rouge which was very red in colour and one wall was covered in a giant poster. Bathroom was great with best shower ever, jets everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “We will recommend to everyone we know who is going to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Colts102294
Reviews.Content: We had the privilege of staying at Secret de Paris Design Hotel in June. The staff greeted us and was so helpful and friendly. They all spoke great English and were able to give us some ideas of how to get to many attractions. They greeted us by name every night and morning. The rooms were so cute and made the trip so much fun to sleep under the Eiffel Tower. The idea to this hotel is to find the key to your dreams and we truly did. The breakfast is additional but so worth the money and a great way to start your day off. They make eggs any way you want and mine was served using the eggs for eyes, the ham for a nose and the toast for the mouth. The staff is so much fun to be around. They serve cocktails in the evening and it was a great way to end our day. They gave us a map and told us about the double Decker tour bus that we took to see ALL of Paris and it was a great and fun way to see the city. They have computers that they will let you use to check and send emails in the lobby. The rooms have CD and DVD players in case you want to watch a movie. The kindness of those entire staff was out of this world. Staying at this hotel was a hugh part of us having such a great memory of Paris. I highly recommend you staying here and enjoying a wonderful boutique hotel experience. It is a PERFECT place to stay. Look no further this is your hotel to stay at. (Keep in mind I travel a LOT for work and this is one of the BEST hotels I have stayed at ANYWHERE. Book this hotel and enjoy your stay!!)

Reviews.Title: “This place won't be a secret for long...”
Reviews.Author: Jacsicle_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this little gem of a hotel for 9 nights in June. I cannot rave enough about the quality of this hotel, from the charming rooms to the wonderful staff. When we checked into the hotel we were shown around the hotel and our room personally by one of their lovely staff. When we got to our room we were also presented with a bottle of Moet and little snacks as a thank you for our "extended stay". If this lovely little gesture wasn't enough, when we checked out they also removed one of the breakfasts that we had at the hotel from our bill. We stayed in the Musee d'Orsay themed room, but were also given the option of switching rooms if we liked throughout our stay. We were so comfortable and loved our room so much we ended up staying put. The spa in the room and rain shower are perfect after a full day of sightseeing, and the different lighting concepts were a nice touch. A lot of people complain about the size of the rooms... to this, all i have to say is that you have picked the wrong city. Considering how little time you spend in the room when holidaying in Paris, it is more than ample in size. The beds are comfortable I think this hotel is perfect for couples but probably not as suitable for families. Thank you so much to the team at Secret de Paris for making our stay in Paris so wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “The quietest hotel in Paris - Service is TOP NOTCH”
Reviews.Author: vorsoni
Reviews.Content: I hesitated writing this review because I am afraid my fave hotel in Paris will not be available next time I want to book it! I have been coming back to Paris every single 8 weeks for the past 12 years. I have tried numerous hotels: from chain hotels to palaces, bed and breakfast et al. This is the FIRST time ever I find a hotel with truly quiet rooms. Amazing! The insomniac I am could finally sleep. Amenities are neat: in-room Jacuzzi with chromotherapy, zen lighting, etc.... Champagne bottle when you check in. Staff is simply amazing: smiling (not-so-easy to find in Paris believe me) and very helpful. I had several radio/TV interviews and I could be refreshed thanks to the staff amazing work and the hotel great construction. I will definitely go back there though I just discovered that my secret is too well known, it is fully booked for next week :( ps: I wanted soy milk for breakfast, they offered to go and buy some for me which they could keep in their fridge for my upcoming breakfasts....

Reviews.Title: “Stop searching for an other hotel and book this one”
Reviews.Author: Yannick_Martens
Reviews.Content: It was a really nice hotel. it was an surprice for my girlfriend and when she saw the rooms i saw it in her eyes that she loved it. The rooms where big enough and had all the comfort we needed, even some extra. Especially the service was verry nice. If you wanted advise, they were always ready to take time for you. Viorica and Giulia helped us with everything, from what to see to what to do and what to eat, the advise was excellent. Thanks to them my weekend was a succes Their english was verry good so i didn't had to try speaking French. When i go back to Paris, i'm not going to search for a hotel. I know for sure, im going back to secret de Paris. Thank you, Secret de paris, Viorica & Giulia for the nice weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: louisem123456
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Secret de Paris for four nights for our Honeymoon, and we had an amazing time. When we arrived at the hotel we were given complimentary cocktails, then given a quick tour of the hotel and shown to our room - the Musee D'Orsay room. The room was gorgeous with mood lighting, jacuzzi bath and a rain shower, and there were bathrobes and slippers to use, and complimentary water and orange juice. It was quite hot in Paris when we there and it was great to come back to the cool air conditioned room and chill out. We had breakfast every morning which, again, was just lovely - fresh croissants and pastries, cold meats and cheese, cereal and eggs - perfect! The hotel is in a good location with plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby and two metro stations within 5 minutes walk. Finally I just want to stay how friendly and helpful the staff were while we there, thank you and hopefully we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Greta hotel, brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: cmskindeep
Reviews.Content: Not too far from the city centre & close to the Moulin Rouge, Near to the Metro so an ideal base for exploring Paris. The hotel is small & because of that all the staff know you & treat you very well. Nothing is too much trouble & always smiling. I would stay there again without hesitation. No proble with communications as thier perfect English made up for my poor grasp of the French language. The rooms are small but well designed , it's the forst time I've stayed in a boutique hotel & really loved it.

Reviews.Title: “achingly hip hotel for a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: madameswanLondon
Reviews.Content: one of the most original, hip, fantasically designed hotels I haver ever stayed in. It was so romantic. We stayed in the red walled Moulin Rouge room.Not your usual run- of- the- mill hotels. The bed was very comfy with lovely Egyptian cotton sheets. The room was soundproofed and could not hear any noise from other rooms or outside. A big flat screen telly, free mini bar water and orange juice, which I thought was a very nice touch indeed as most hotels charge rip off prices for water. The is free wi fi internet in the bedrooms as well as their pleasant public areas. The bathroom was lovely with a multijet shower and good products. Also a bathrobe and slippers were provided. The breakfast was continental and lovely, was 17 EUROS per person. I have to say the staff were exceptional!!, so friendly, nothing was a big deal for them. They were really pleasant and helpful. They made our stay so memorable. You will be treated respectfully here, they made us feel welcome. The hotel is near some cafes and bars..loads of Japanese restaurants for some reason. If you like sushi you will be spoilt for choice. It was not an amazing area it's very arty not at all posh. It was also near the metro and near the Euro star station., it was about 15 EUROS. I recommend this hotel to all, we found it romantic and different with amazing staff..book it you will love it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JC9079
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was great. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We arrived quite late and were helped in finding somewhere to go for a bite to eat. Breakfast was excellent. Delicious crossants and coffee. My husband enjoyed the omlettes. I thought the room was a good size. The bathroom had a huge bath with whirlpool system. Apparently it had some light therapy thing too but we couldn't get it to work. My only minor criticism - I had to look under the bed to retrieve a lost slipper and it looked like the cleaner had just swept all the rubbish under there. Also the room was very dusty on our last day. The bathroom was always very clean though. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again if I was in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a romantic trip in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ChunkyMonkeyBristol
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a weekend break in Paris, the Musee de Orsay themed room we stayed in was spectacular. The rooms are not big but we certainly didn't find it too small. The mood lighting has four settings from full lighting to very subtle lighting (and off!) Our room also had a TV that raised out of the end of the bed which was a very nice touch. There was a dvd/cd player so remember your cds if you fancy listening to some music. The bathroom was stunning with a jacuzzi bath. It has been open just over a year and the rooms were spotless, we did not see any dirt anywhere. This really is the perfect place for a romantic weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “A great little find in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: LHBOR
Reviews.Content: A gem of a hotel, in a great location. The staff are very friendly, the rooms immaculate and very original in design. The location is great, within walking distance of the Grands Magasins and the Opera, and there are also metro and bus stops nearby. If you are looking for something unusual but classy, I would recommend Le Secret de Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, modern Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loububs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Secret de Paris whilst on a mini break in Paris with my mum. We secured a great rate which included breakfast (this is continental with eggs to order). We had the Trocadero twin bedded room and it was lovely, clean and a good use of space. I loved the whirlpool bath in the room which we used every night after a day of sightseeing. The only down side was the room lacked tea / coffee making facilites. There was no street noise and a large flat screen tv with dvd player if required. We throughly enjoyed our stay at Secret and I would definetely look to stay there again on a return trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky boutique hotel with friendly staff and in good location”
Reviews.Author: MidcoVincent
Reviews.Content: It is a quirky boutique hotel with themed rooms. We stayed at the Eiffel Tower room for 2 nights at the beginning of the year. Room is on the small side as most of the hotel rooms in Paris are but adequate. The bathroom is actually quite spacious. There is a bathtub in our room and it was very relaxing to have a bath after a day of sightseeing. Complimentary toiletry products are available and you could just call and ask the staff to bring up anything that is not already in your room or bathroom like toothbrush and extra pillows. You also have 2 complimentary bottles of water and orange juice for the first day of your stay which is nice. The staff was very friendly. The location of the hotel is good. There are 2 metro stations that are within 5 minute walking distance. It is a good choice if you are looking for a romantic hotel with quirky decoration.

Reviews.Title: “â€œExcellent! Great staff, quiet rooms and good amenities.”
Reviews.Author: GAM1937
Reviews.Content: This trip was a Christmas present. Hotel staff were welcoming and most helpful; advising on and making a restaurant booking, helping with directions to various locations etc. The room while not "huge' was very adequate though I did not like the shape of the bath - uncomfortable for a tall person. The cooked breakfast was freshly prepared to order and the buffet choices were varied and more than adequate. The croissants were exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Not your average hotel room!”
Reviews.Author: rbteton
Reviews.Content: I finally had the opportunity to stay at Secret de Paris. I've looked over their site several times over the past few years, but always ended up staying in another section of the city. I was not disappointed. I chose the Musee d' Orsay themed room and it was I nice change from the usual run-of-the-mill hotel options. The room was very well done, complete with several different lighting options, each providing a unique ambiance; both for the room, and bathroom as well. I'm looking forward to returning with my wife this summer. She wants to book one of the Moulan Rouge rooms. The furnishings and bathrooms are modern, and the rooms are good sized for Paris standards. The staff was extremely friendly and quite helpful.

Reviews.Title: “disapointing, poor value”
Reviews.Author: carstef
Reviews.Content: I had thought that it would be romantic and fun, it was very tiny, and did not deliver on its hype seemed more trasy than trendy and more seedy than fun. Poor choice of room may be but the dim red light got on your nerves after a very short space of time and the bathroom was incredibly small, showering soaked the whole bathroom. Didnt like the general area either, after 4 days still had not found a half decent place for a coffee let alone a nice dinner. It was handy for bus and metro and the staff were pleasent and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option”
Reviews.Author: PHILIPMARSHALL
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights on a business trip. Prefer to avoid large chains and booked this based on tripadvisor reviews. Overall very positive experience. Positives: 1. Quick check-in. I arrived early and room wasn't ready, but they gave me the first available room. 2. Location...slightly away from center but metro station 2min walk away. 3. Rooms well laid out (& original design). Very clean, soft carpets. Impressive lighting and shower options. 4. Complimentary minibar drinks. 5. Never used the sauna/gym but looked new/comfortable. Negatives (no major ones, couple of minor ones): 1. No dining option in the evening, only room-service. But can have drinks downstairs and breakfast in the morning. 2. Bathroom quite small, even tight getting into/out of the shower unit. Overall this was a very positive experience, good value compared to majority of hotels in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic 2nd Wedding Anniversary Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Ms-Holiday090
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband flew into Charles De Gaulles from Luton, Uk. We travelled to Secret De Paris with ease on the public transport trains. Upon arriving at the hotel we were greeted by very polite reception staff who gave us a free cocktail upon arrival and we were offered seat in the bar. We arrived early and the staff were kind enough to allow us early entry to our room . The hotel is presented beautifully with running themes for each floor - my husband picked the 'Opera' for our room theme and the room although very small was lovely with ballerina shoes hanging from the bed posts, the reception lady took us to our room and gave us a mini tour describing the room which e found very helpful. The hotel is expensive for only bed and breakfast but Paris is a very expensive place. The bathroom was pure luxury with a corner bath tub which also acted as a jacuzzi. We had a big flatscreen but unfortunately not one english speaking channel and you can get dvd's from reception for free but these are also french so we didn't watch much tv instead opting to play music. Whenever we called reception which I did a few times the staff were always happy to help you and no question was un answered. We used the basement gym and sauna/stem room facility which were total bliss. Breakfast was a serve yourself posh buffet and it was amazing with plenty of choice for a small hotel. Overall our two night stay was fantastic and very romantic.

Reviews.Title: “gem of accomodation”
Reviews.Author: SallyAnneRoux
Reviews.Content: Super boutique hotel, charming and unique would happily slap the designer label on the decor, rooms and layout. Great mood lighting and enjoyed the rain shower and the jacuzzi type bath, very relaxing after a hectic day. Wonderful to have a gym/sauna on site. Service was outstanding. Staff are young, attentive, fun and nothing is too much trouble, be it locating a store, organizing transport, contacting the airlines or just making your stay more streamlined. Breakfast was fabulous, best scrambled eggs I've had EVER, and croissants were just perfect. Very impressed. Personally I would have preferred the situation closer to Opera but it was a stroll away from Montmartre and Galleria Layfayette and taxis were everywhere so transport wasn't a problem. That aside this property was fabulous and I highly recommend it to anyone visiting Paris. The price, the staff, the rooms were all outstanding. I'll be back and will tell all our friends about this secret! Congratulations!

Reviews.Title: “Experience the Delight of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Fromacrossthesea
Reviews.Content: This was my first holiday to Paris and staying at the Secret de Paris ensured that it was my most enchanting vacation yet. I walked into the hotel completely exhausted from the flight over the sea and was greeted with a comfortable intimate atmosphere and I immediately knew I had made the rght choice when I changed my itenerary. Raphael and staff were nothing but helpful, friendly and completely accomodating. My Blackberry "died" when I arrived so, first thing was to use the complimentary laptop and internet to establish communication with home. The staff told me the best thing to do woudl be get a calling card to use while i was there-perfect! The room was exquisit. The rain shower and deep whirlpool tub were awesome and a great way to start and end the days! I stayed in the Tour de Eiffel room and it was just as described. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in in all my travels period. For me, the location was great! It's close to the metro and is walking distance from everything. Of course you have to like to walk. I do, and walked from the hotel across to the La Grande Rou Ferris Wheel every day. No worries staying here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Delighted with every aspect of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Notakenin
Reviews.Content: This is the most imaginatively designed hotel I have ever stayed in. The room we had was on the small side but the design cleverly masked this. Our only negative comment was the limited hanging space Everything was clean and well presented. EVERY member of staff conveyed a pride in their hotel and made us feel welcome and valued. At 17 euros the breakfast is reasonable value if you have a large appetite but if all you want is a continental breakfast then this is readily available at half the price in one of the many nearby brasseries. When we next visit Paris this hotel will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “A gorgeous and spotless Gem”
Reviews.Author: GemmaAshley
Reviews.Content: We had the most amazing stay at SECRET DE PARIS Viorica, concierge is a delight and was so helpful with any requests we had We stayed in the EIfel Tower room which was divine and were so impressed with every little finish. The gym is beautifully equipped and the beds were very comfy. I honestly have nothing bad to say about this wonderful hotel We cant wait to go back We adored the mood lighting and the great spa bath.

Reviews.Title: “All of Paris in one Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LadyEdiSpencer
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night visit to Paris. We chose the Secret de Paris based on what it looked like on their web site and TA reviews. When we arrived we were greeted by the reception team and invited into the breakfast area for a drink whilst our bags were taken up to our room. We were taken to our room and had everything explained to us. The lighting, TV, DVD, shower functions, steam room, sauna.... Yes the room is quite small, but they all are in Paris. We stayed in a Moulin Rouge room which we thought was great. The red lighting was quite dark but you could have brighter whiter lighting if you wanted. We were told we could have a different room each night if available, which we thought was really nice, but we stayed put. Very good double glazing. We couldn't hear the street from our bedroom. Each day I asked for the sauna and steam room to be turned on and within half an hour they were ready. They are small but functional. The gym equipment looked quite professional. Breakfast was basic but nice. The usual cold buffet plus a choice of eggs scrambled, omelette..... The Hotel was very clean. Our room was spotless each day when we returned. Overall the service and the staff were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Considering”
Reviews.Author: PAL021
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I recently spent a weekend here and both of us have mixed feelings about the Hotel. Whilst the room was well appointed it really was small and the bathroom which again was well appointed was a glass box installed within it. The theme of the room, we chose the Eiffel Tower, was fun and the mood lighting was excellent although you had to turn on all the room lights to go to the bathroom during the night. The hotel was very clean throughout. We felt the common areas were poor with no bar to speak of. We did not take breakfast at the hotel but in a number of Paris cafes. In summary I think how you judge this hotel depends on what you pay. Get a good rate and it would be excellent, otherwise the small rooms and lack of a traditionhal bar would be a let down.

Reviews.Title: “Ssssssh its a secret .......”
Reviews.Author: Re-viewer-Traveller
Reviews.Content: This needs to be kept a secret indeed ! This hotel is extraordinary from it decor through to it customer service it is with out doubt the best hotel we stayed at in Europe. From entering the Hotel we were welcomed by the warm staff at the door. They offered to show us all the rooms they had avaliable so that we could choose. We looked at all the rooms yes for american or australian standards some are a little small but this is Paris and you expect smaller rooms. The fit out and decor of each room is spectacular. Beds very comfortable. The Hotel is located in what taxi drivers and locals describe as a very "Parisian" area , it is a 5 minute walk to a train and has a bus stop a minute away. No it is not next to the Eiffel Tower or other monuments..... this is real Paris ! Stay here you will not be disappointed ! But please don't tell anyone lets keep it just to ourselves !

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant little Secret of Paris”
Reviews.Author: DanaDrury
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to get a booking for this hotel while in Bordeaux only a few days before arriving in Paris and what a gem it is! The staff and the hotel are lovely. Other reviews already detail the various room themes available. Yes the rooms are quite small depending on which one you get however you do get the opportunity to try a new room each day if you so wish (and if they are available). Breakfast was wonderful and the staff spoke English and were helpful on all number of matters. It is on the expensive side, but given what you get I thought it was value for money. While it is not central to some parts of Paris it is a two minute walk into Montmarte, the Moulin Rouge and two metro stops. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and I hope they keep up the good work - it's not a 5 star hotel but if you're after a good stay in a charming hotel then certainly give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “For a weekend stay you can't do better”
Reviews.Author: mdc26
Reviews.Content: Very difficult to fault. Location great, very easy access to Metro (which you must use...very cheap, quick & convenient). Staff very friendly. Rooms small (as always in Paris) but decor great, very quiet and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LucyWoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Secret de Paris for 3 nights in October for a romantic break. The hotel is in an execellent location, a few minutes walk from a metro station and an abundance of restaurants. The hotel room was quirky and very clean. It was a little small but well appointed so it wasn't really a problem. We stayed in the Eiffel Tower room which didn't have a bath as advertised on expedia which was a litlle dissapointing but I suppose not the fault of the hotel! My only other gripe would be that there was no kettle in the room so to have a hot drink you need to call room service. As mentioned by others the lighting in the rooms is a real feature. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Overall we thought this was a brilliant hotel and we would definately stay here again if in Paris.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible experience all around”
Reviews.Author: ranch88
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful trip to Paris. We stayed at Hotel Secret which was amazing. The service from the front desk (Raphael) was beyond expectations. They were friendly, helpful and incredibly accomodating. The rooms were well appointed and very quiet. The breakfast service was perfect. The best Croissants I have ever tasted. We will stay here for sure on our next visit. We highly recommend you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Great staff, quiet rooms and good amenities... you should try it!”
Reviews.Author: FIBLisbon
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights in this excellent hotel. The location is great, near the metro. The room, itself, is not very large, but it fits perfectly for all purposes and it has wide flat screen TV and DVD. The bathroom has a jacuzzi bach (it's great for relax). The room decoration is well inspired. If you want to rest from all noises (street and neighbours) try this hotel, it's very quiet. It has also fitness room, shaman and sauna. The breakfast is good, but expensive. The staff is very nice and kind.. they all speak English... I really recommend it and I hope to be there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and upgraded”
Reviews.Author: TomKuhne
Reviews.Content: As a present for my mother I booked this Paris themed boutique-hotel which led to an unforgetable stay! The hotel is well situated in a quiet area but just 5 mins walking from the amusement area Place de Clichy and from metro station LiÃ¨ge with direct connections to the Champs ElysÃ©es. After the friendly welcome at reception, the receptionist brought us to our upgraded room, the Atelier d'artiste room. It is a light of color, big and very comfortable room. The bouquet of flowers, which I ordered via their site, was very well chosen. I was very pleased that we got a complimentary bottle of Champagne accompanied with olives and a fruit basket! There was even a hand written welcome letter! I stayed in hotels where good service is most important, but this kind of service have I never experienced! The room is equiped with a big flat screen TV, multi cd-player, mood adjusting light and a mini bar with 2 bottles of orange juice and water (included). The jacussi is very comfortable and has a light and massage function. The intercontinental breakfast with enough choice is until 12 a.m. The friendly and helpfull staff, the excellent service and the nicely decorated rooms made this stay memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel review: secrets de Paris, 8th oct...”
Reviews.Author: Basexperience
Reviews.Content: Hotel review: secrets de Paris, 8th oct 2010 - 10th oct 2020 This is truly a hotel worthy of it's current status in TripAdvisor. My wife booked us here because she thought it looked "interesting". This is an understatement. Don't let the google street view put you off - they haven't been back around the street since the hotel opened, and as a result they display what looks like a building site shell! The actual building is rather excellently appointed in a modern style, with lots of funky graphics and a great feel. Highlights include the blue and purple uplighting on the upper floors which mean you can tell you're heading back to the hotel at night - it's instantly recognisable for a good distance down the hill of the rue de clichy - and the lift, which is mirrored on all 6 sides and makes for a matrix-esque moment. We stayed in a moulin rouge themed room, which had a HUGE bed, a very funky wet room bathroom with an enormous ceiling mounted shower, and a huge Samsung LED tv with a DVD player attached which could itself hook up to just about anything, there's a USB port on there which looks like it'll pull MP3s off, and I noticed the speakers either side of the bed in the Dolby 2+1 surround the player supported. I've seen some pictures of the other rooms and they look equally quirky and well kitted out. The advertised free wifi works rather well - it's fast and they've taken the time to put two access points in (from our room on the first floor), so coverage shouldn't be a problem. Location is good - Montmartre's delicious gaudiness is a few minutes' walk, as is the shopping heart of Paris. Get a metro pass though, and you'll be getting around some serious sights in no time - this is in my opinion vital for any short stay in Paris, no matter where you are, so you can really see the sights. If you want to get the Arc de Triomphe and Quasimodo's hang-out done in a day you've got to go metro! All the usual amenities are there, good hairdryer, fridge, aircon. The decor is great fun, and the tech extends to the lighting, which actually has it's own instructions in the room in the hotel information pack. White, red, dimmed... You can definitely crank up the romance in this pad. The hotel has sauna and gym facilities which we were invited to use as we wished - in fact, the concierge said we should ring down 15 mins or so beforehand so they could ensure things were up to temperature. This could come in handy if you've been using the velib public rental bikes: if you want to get around town quickly without braving the metro (which, by the way, is excellent and no more confusing that london's tube network) then there is a bike station with pay point right outside the hotel. This is a good point to mention the helpful nature of the staff here. Whether this is a function of the hotel being new or not, I'd encourage anyone who is thinking of staying in Paris, or running a hotel themselves, to visit this place. They literally cannot do enough for you, and their enthusiasm and smiles are utterly infectious. They get their breakfast stuff from Maison Landemaine down the road - this is well worth a visit, they've got some of the best cakes and croissants I think I've ever tasted. Finally, this place is awesomely reasonable compared to a lot of placed I've stayed in. Get in there ASAP if you're staying in Paris anytime soon. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - perfect for relaxing and great location for siteseeing”
Reviews.Author: fluidescape
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were in Paris for a 12 day vacation. We stayed at this hotel for the last five nights of our vacation (which kicked off the day after we got engaged)! We couldn't have been more pleased with this hotel. It was such a romantic hotel....very clean, trendy, modern, & cutting edge designs. We stayed in the Moulin Rouge & loved it! The shower was excellent, the bed was very comfortable, and the room was a perfect size. The staff was extremely friendly and spoke English very well. They helped us book several nights of entertainment all around town. Most attentive and helpful staff we have ever had. Also, the hotel car service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: HMSoon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent five nights in Paris, the first three in the 3-star Villa St. Martin. Because we were celebrating our wedding anniversary, the folks who own both Villa St. Martin and Secret de Paris upgraded us to the superb, 4-star Secret de Paris for our last two nights in the city of lights. Secret de Paris opened in January and is a small boutique hotel (has around 28 rooms, if I remember correctly). Each room is designed based on a well-known Paris landmark. We stayed in Eiffel Tower room (perfect as my wive's favorite sight in Paris is the tower). Take a look at our picturesâ€”quite the room! The hotel has a Turkish bath, sauna, and exercise room with access included with all reservations. Included with our room was breakfast. The desk attendant told us we could have it in the breakfast room or have breakfast brought to our room for no extra charge. While the breakfast was standard continental fare (fruit, bread, pastries, cheese, cereal, and juice), it also included eggs cooked to order and sausage (being as we're vegetarians, the sausage wasn't exactly a big selling point). Our stay was exceptional in every way. The hotel is superb. Although we won't be able to afford to stay here any time soon, we would love to spend a few more nights at this Parisian jewel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fancy features”
Reviews.Author: dereri
Reviews.Content: After reading all these postivie reviewes of Secret de Paris in here, we decided to stay here for a couple of night of our honeymoon. We were not let down in any way. The staff is courteous, friendly and very serviceminded. Examples of the latter is the little guided tour of our "Musee d'Orsay" room we got upon arrival (fancy light settings, and TV hidden in foot end of the bed), and the help we got when we lost a few tickets underneath the TV. Location is great, close to Montmarte with all its cosy shops and restaurants (and the Moulin of you're into shows), and a mere 10mins walk to Galleries Lafayette, the Garnier Opera an Printemps. We ordered the additional breakfast which was well worth it. Fresh croissants (of course), baguettes, bread, cereals and youghurt. Even had some warm breakfast options. Will absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone, but especially couples.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful find.”
